Let's see if we can find the pattern that connects each number.

$3\overset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}6\overset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 12 \overset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 24$

The pattern is to start at $3$ and multiply by $2$ each time.

$3\overset{\blueD{\times~2}}{{\rightarrow}}6\overset{\blueD{\times~2}}{\rightarrow} 12 \overset{\blueD{\times~2}}{\rightarrow} 24$
The rule for the pattern $3, 6, 12, 24$ is start with $3$ and $\blueD {\text{multiply by } 2}$ each time.
